summary: Zagreb is Croatia's biggest city and capital, located in the north. With a population of over 760,000, it's a significant cultural and economic hub. The city has a long history, dating back to Roman times, and became a free royal city in 1242. Zagreb is divided into 17 districts, some near the Sava River and others in the Medvednica mountain foothills. It's a major transport center, connecting Central Europe, the Mediterranean, and Southeast Europe. Zagreb boasts a strong economy, with high-tech industries and a high quality of life.
title: Zagreb
